DOC.HEAD: Brazilian Kidnappers Release Businessman Hostage
DOC.TEXT: Heavily armed kidnappers claiming allegiance to a Chilean revolutionary group released a supermarket tycoon Sunday and turned themselves over to authorities. After receiving guarantees of safety, the kidnappers _ a Canadian woman and six South American men _ left the house in which they held Abilio Diniz Filho and boarded a bus that took them to police headquarters for interrogation. The 53-year-old Diniz Filho, with a stubble and looking haggard but otherwise in good condition, emerged from the house smiling and was greeted by applause after nearly a week in captivity. A police van drove him to a luxury apartment where his former wife and his children live. More than 200 police, armed with rifles, machine guns and shotguns, surrounded the house in a lower middle-class neighborhood of Sao Paulo at dawn Saturday. The kidnappers demanded $200,000, an armored car and a plane to escape to another country, but police refused to negotiate on those demands. Diniz Filho is vice president of Pao de Acucar supermarket chain, one of Brazil's largest. He was kidnapped Dec. 11 in front of his house in Sao Paulo. His brother, Alcides Diniz, said the kidnappers never demanded ransom. Police Inspector Nelson Silveira Guimaraes said the seven _ four Chileans, one Argentine, one Brazilian and the Canadian woman _ ``told us they belonged to Chile's Revolutionary Leftist Movement.'' They were not identified. He said police believed they also took part in the abduction of Brazilian advertising executive Luiz Sales in July. Sales was released after his family paid $2.5 million in ransom. Accompanying the kidnappers in the bus were Roman Catholic Cardinal Paulo Evaristo Arns, archbishop of Sao Paulo, who took part in the negotiations; and former Finance Minister Luiz Carlos Bresser Pereira, a senior executive at Pao de Acucar. Bresser Pereira told reporters that part of the agreement with the kidnappers was that the supermarket chain would pay for their legal defense.
